pr_title: GEODE-7884: server hangs due to IllegalStateException

timeline.bodyText: does synchronizing here relate to removing the continues in the timer code?
timeline.author: echobravopapa

replies.bodyText: The synchronizations and cancel checks fix GEODE-7884.  The SystemTimer changes, except for adding isCancelled(), are unrelated.  I made those changes so that I could test isCancelled() and add test coverage for SystemTimer.
replies.author: bschuchardt

timeline.author: echobravopapa

replies.bodyText: hmm - I'll check into that.  Thanks Ernie
replies.author: bschuchardt

timeline.bodyText: nice move breaking a dependency on an internal class
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText: seems like we shouldn't call this a "swarm" any more
timeline.author: Bill
Bill

timeline.bodyText:
the name "swarmSet" is misleading. It's really a list of timers associated with this swarm. Furthermore, we blindly add the timer to the list, making it even less of a "set" than the mere name vs type discrepancy might indicate.
if duplicates do not hurt us, or if there is no possibility of duplicates, I suppose it's ok to not check for duplicates. Nevertheless. If we aren't eliding dupes tho, I feel like the name should change.
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText: the name "swarmIterator" is misleading to me since it's iterating over timers. recommend name change
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText: again the naming confuses me. It would make more sense to me if it was named something like "timers"
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText: as above, I request renaming "swarmSet" to something like "timers"
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText: Glad you got rid of this dead constructor. I disliked it because it was dead. But I hated it because it was not chained.
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText:
I see idleTask is never changed from non-null back to null ✓ OTOH since the variable is neither volatile nor guarded when we do the null-check, it is possible that if setIdleTimeoutTask() was called from a different thread than close() we could leak tasks.
I feel like maybe idleTask and ackTimeoutTask need to be volatile for this reason. Or maybe they need to be final and set from the constructor.
timeline.author: Bill

replies.bodyText: It's likely that these variables are set in one thread and then accessed in another, so I've followed your advice and made them volatile.  I've also added checks in the two timer tasks to cancel themselves if they see that the Connection they're monitoring has closed.  That should stop any remaining leaks.
replies.author: bschuchardt

timeline.message:
GEODE-7884: server hangs due to IllegalStateException

Added cancellation check before scheduling an idle-timeout or
ack-wait-threshold timer task.  I had to add a new method to
SystemTimerTask and then noticed there were no tests for SystemTimer, so
I cleaned up that class and added tests.
adding missing copyright header to new test
reinstating 'continue' when encountering a null timer during a sweep

addressing Bill's comments

renamed swarm everwhere
made the collection of timers associated with a DistributedSystem into a Set
made timer task variables in Connection volatile
added checks in tasks to cancel themselves if their Connection is closed

addressing Bill's comments

renamed swarm everwhere
made the collection of timers associated with a DistributedSystem into a Set
made timer task variables in Connection volatile
added checks in tasks to cancel themselves if their Connection is closed
